critique: The document expresses the intent to enforce Section 9(c) of an act of Congress and an order from July 11, 1933. The tone is formal and authoritative. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and assurance that the laws are being enforced. There is a hint of surprise that it is necessary to reinforce the order. There is no indication of joy, sadness, fear, or disgust.
